In general, the essence of the NABB is to represent the interests of
educational radio and television broadcasting and the institutions which form its
membership. It is a national association- and organisation. It has an interest
in the development of the whole field of communications. It should strive to
add to the coverage of educational communication through the support and development
of additional stations. It should strive to establish and achieve a professional
status and function for its member stations rather than a purely operational
status and function. It should achieve and fulfill a "network" character and
responsibility, with political, educational and social purposes and objectives.
It requires a sound organization, competent staff, and adequate funds.
